URL-blocked-sites
entry.action-desc: URL blocking based on temp late settings

entry.name: Traffic-drop-policy
entry.action-desc: EDL and any other drop rules

entry.description: SKILLETLIB log forwarding settings

entry.name: Log-all
entry.description: log all stuff

entry.name: NTP-DNS port misuse
entry.caption: NTP-DNS port misuse
entry.query: ((port.dst eq 53) and (app neq dns)) or ((port.dst eq 123)

entry.name: tunnel.100
entry.comment: Tunnel interface added by Panhandler Snippet

system.login-banner: This device is the property of SKILLETLIB Company and any unauthorized access is strictly prohibited and logged.

entry.name: elk-ports
entry.description: lab access to elasticstack

entry.name: HOME-block-high-risk-IP
entry.description: This rule prevents outbound traffic to high risk IP addresses per the Palo Alto Networks EDL.

entry.name: HOME-block-known-malicious-IP
entry.description: This rule prevents outbound traffic to malicious IP addresses per the Palo Alto Networks EDL.

entry.name: HOME-no-log-ntp-syslog
entry.description: This rule prevents logging of low-risk well-known applications that are sourced from the device

entry.name: HOME-deny-quic
entry.description: Block Google QUIC sessions and force usage of TLS/SSL

entry.name: HOME-no-unknown-url-file-xfer
entry.description: This rule prevents the download of WF supported and risky file types from unknown category URL's.

entry.name: HOME-allow-outbound
entry.description: This is a general rule to allow trust to untrust traffic. It uses application defaults to prevent applications from running on non-default undefined ports. This is part of the App-ID support in the firewall

entry.name: HOME-non-def-SSL-ports
entry.description: This is a complement to the allow-outbound rule to ensure sessions can be established and the proper application determined. Once determined, the session will shift to the allow-outbound rule.

entry.name: HOME-non-def-web-ports
entry.description: Provide visibility for non-default web browsing applications. Will provide security profile coverage and will allow based if a non-default port for the application. VISIBILITY ONLY and not app evasion

entry.name: HOME-find-non-def-apps
entry.description: This is a temporary safety net rule to find apps not on non-default ports. It still has the Gold security profile to look for threats, block bad URL's, and send files to WF.

entry.description: This rule prevents outbound traffic to high risk IP addresses per the Palo Alto Networks EDL.

entry.name: GP-to-Trust-and Untrust
entry.description: This is a policy that allows access of all services and protocols to pass from the GP-zone to the Trust zone and the Untrust zone.

To access the network, you must first connect to GlobalProtect.

Captive Portal Detected

GlobalProtect has temporarily permitted network access for you to connect to the Internet. Follow instructions from your internet provider.

If you let the connection time out, open GlobalProtect and click Connect to try again.
You have attempted to access a protected resource that requires additional authentication. Proceed to authenticate at
